programme.title: Thai Street Food
programme.desc: Thai chef Pailin Chongchitnant shows us the secrets behind Bangkok’s famous street food with pork skewers, noodle soup, five-spice pork belly soup, and pandan coconut custard fondue.

programme.title: Sweet and Sour
programme.desc: Sweet and sour are definitely on the menu as Thai-born chef Pailin Chongchitnant whips up glass noodle salad, sour curry, sweet and sour stir fry, and pineapple and lychee in iced syrup.

programme.title: Dairy with Tim McRoberts
programme.desc: Mmmm dairy! Rich, creamy – a texture like non-other. Chef Tim McRoberts shows us how to cook like Mom - butter, butter and egg-based sauces, custard and cream.

programme.title: BBQ with Michael Allemeier
programme.desc: Y’all know how to BBQ? Well, you will do after Chef Allemeier reveals the tricks of a true Southern BBQ complete with a hog roast, brisket and BBQ sauce.

programme.title: Ajillo (Garlic)
programme.desc: Chef Luis “Tigretón” Leon cooks up three succulent dishes that are sure to please any garlic lover.

programme.title: Spain's Specialty: Pork
programme.desc: Simple and sophisticated is the best way to describe Chef Luis “Tigretón” Leon’s traditional Spanish recipes. He shows us why trout and ham is the new surf and turf.

programme.title: Egg Episode with Chef Katie Ardington
programme.desc: Eggs are a perfect beginning for so many recipes and meals; Chef-host Katie Ardington is happy to "whisk" us along through a few of her favourites!

programme.title: Tomato Episode with Chef Natalia Machado
programme.desc: Join our host, Chef Natalia Machado as she introduces us to her favourite techniques for using a wide variety of versatile, savoury tomatoes.

programme.title: Italian Staples
programme.desc: Gnocchi, polenta, pesto, oh my! Warm host Vanessa Gianfrancesco shares how to make delicious Italian staples.

programme.title: Teriyaki Two Ways
programme.desc: Host Hana Etsuko Dethlefsen showcases how easy it is to incorporate Japanese flavours into everyday meals.

programme.title: Pork with Ned Bell
programme.desc: For Chef Ned Bell pork in this episode is all about adding a new twist to old family favorites. Chef serves up brined pork chops stuffed with fruit, roasted pork tenderloin with a port cranberry sauce and more!

programme.title: Chocolate with Chef Michael Bonacini
programme.desc: Chef Michael Bonacini creates works of art with chocolate. His unique twist on everybody’s favourite includes chocolate noodles, and how to build a delicious tower of cocoa cake wrapped in chocolate and acetate.

programme.title: Skydiving
programme.desc: Matt and the Team “drop in” on a group of thrill seeking skydivers at a Skydiving Jamboree. They let the BBQs rip and grill up three different kinds of wings – smoked, jerked and ‘suicide hot’. Then they cool things down with an asparagus cucumber salad.

programme.title: Go Karting
programme.desc: Matt and the Road Grill Team put the pedal to the metal at the Go Kart Track. They crank up the heat on the grills and pull out all the stops making Summertime Pizza, Sticky BBQ Chicken, Smoked Turkey Pastrami Sandwiches and a Summer Mellon Ball Salad.

programme.title: Fruit
programme.desc: Chef and seafood lover Spencer Watts mixes the sweet flavours of fruit with fish as he makes dishes with salmon and scallops.

programme.title: Dairy
programme.desc: Seafood and dairy make the perfect partners. Watch as Chef Spencer Watts creates some dairy-infused dishes using red snapper and scampi.

programme.title: Thai Street Food
programme.desc: Thai chef Pailin Chongchitnant shows us the secrets behind Bangkok’s famous street food with pork skewers, noodle soup, five-spice pork belly soup, and pandan coconut custard fondue.

programme.title: Sweet and Sour
programme.desc: Sweet and sour are definitely on the menu as Thai-born chef Pailin Chongchitnant whips up glass noodle salad, sour curry, sweet and sour stir fry, and pineapple and lychee in iced syrup.

programme.title: Spring Fusion
programme.desc: Crispy, crunchy, salty, and sweet - Chef Spencer Watts prepares a Spring-inspired Thai feast in under 30 minutes, for around 30 dollars.

programme.title: Comfort
programme.desc: In 30 minutes, chef Spencer Watts cooks up homey classics including a mouth-watering Chicken Stew and melt-in-your-mouth Herb Butter Biscuits.

programme.title: Ajillo (Garlic)
programme.desc: Chef Luis “Tigretón” Leon cooks up three succulent dishes that are sure to please any garlic lover.

programme.title: Sauces with Chef Tim Roberts
programme.desc: Chef Tim McRoberts demonstrates the techniques to making some delicious sauces suitable for any occasion. Chef makes a light Piri-Piri sauce drizzled over a perfectly roasted chicken, a ruby and a white port sauce each perfect for a tender cut of lamb and finally three great sauces that heighten a tuna steak to new levels.

programme.title: Ultimate Tournament
programme.desc: Matt and the Road Grill team grill up a feast for some hungry athletes at the Ultimate Frisbee Tournament. Jumbo shrimp with a rosemary dry rub, Slo-smoked Pork Butt in a Papaya Marinade, and Asian Pasta Salad have the athletes asking for more.

programme.title: Steam Train
programme.desc: The Antique Steam train is in town! Matt and the team give the crowd something to chew-chew on with delicious Grilled Vegetable Quesadillas, Honey Mustard Chicken Drumsticks, Grilled Turkey Burgers with Pineapple Salsa, and Grilled Corn with Orange Butter

programme.title: Surf and Turf
programme.desc: Get the best of both land and sea as Chef Spencer Watts creates fun surf and turf dishes featuring halibut and lobster.

programme.title: The Smokebox
programme.desc: On this episode the two exchange stories about having a couple run ins with the law involving marijuana, Jay & Silent Bob Reboot, how cannabis saved Kevin's life + more.

programme.title: Ep. 12 - How A Catholic Principal Embraced Cannabis
programme.desc: Sue Taylor is the CEO of The Farmacy, an innovative dispensary in Berkeley, CA with a focus on serving the senior community, but if you would have told her that one day she would be a powerhouse in the cannabis industry, she would be the first one to laugh at the idea. Hear her incredible journey and how her perception towards cannabis shifted in the most unexpected way; saving her life. It’s a story that every young person contemplating a career in cannabis should know. Be divinely inspired by her words of wisdom and spiritual guidance.

programme.title: Field Trip in Top Tier of NASDAQ
programme.desc: Last week, Field Trip Health (TSX: FTRP; OTCMKTS: FTRPF) solidified its place among the elite psychedelic companies in the space. The uplist announcement to the NASDAQ Global Select Market—the highest echelon in the NASDAQ group of listings—was an extension of a prolonged news cycle which has helped boost its common shares +33.39% since the start of Q2 2021. We invited CEO Ronan Levy to TDR’s interview chair to expand on this and other relevant company events. - Here’s some highlights from the interview: - - Field Trip has secured the highest tier designation on the NASDAQ exchange - - Ronan also dives in-depth into his company’s business operations, including exciting new compound FT-104, a novel - - The company’s therapy protocols are based on scientific study and ancient psychedelic traditions gleaned from generations past

programme.title: MDMA-Assisted Therapy for PTSD
programme.desc: A new report just released this week by Nature Medicine has a lot of players in both medicine and the psychedelics industry talking. MDMA and other psychedelics like psilocybin have been under scrutiny lately as a possible avenue of treatment for not only PTSD but mental health issues generally. Dr. Mike Hart is back to chat again with us about that report on MDMA-Assisted therapy for severe PTSD. Dr. Hart is the Host of Heart to Hart Podcast and a medical doctor at the Ready To Go Clinic in London, Ontario. - Here’s some highlights from the interview: - - PTSD very difficult to treat - - Hart says that MDMA-Assisted therapy works because the psychedelic reduces ego - - Hart feels legalization within a year unlikely, and other MDMA-assisted therapy studies will improve

programme.title: It Happened One Night
programme.desc: Biscotti takes Croissant out for a night of Debauchery in the junk food slums where he is inspired by a beautiful hallucination.

programme.title: The Pain of Chocolate
programme.desc: Croissant becomes lead detective when he accidentally frames Donut for assaulting Peanut, then accidentally attacks Pain Au Chocolate when she very un-accidentally tries to start a revolution.

programme.title: Who Are You?
programme.desc: Croissant gets caught in a Dream and Drive and accidentally runs over Peanut who is running away from Donut.

programme.title: Prisoners
programme.desc: Croissant gets fired and vows to find Donut while Peanut and Pain Au Chocolat strike up a friendship.

programme.title: Why?
programme.desc: Donut attacks Croissant at his home but is infected by his existential crisis when Croissant remembers life is meaningless. Pain Au Chocolat reconnects with her lost Junk food love, only to find she wants nothing to do with her.

programme.title: The Duality of Pain
programme.desc: Donut and Croissant bond over a TV Marathon, while Pain Au Chocolat and Peanut make fools of themselves in the Junk Food slums.

programme.title: Love Was Lost
programme.desc: Pain Au Chocolat finally reveals the details of her across the tracks love story, while Croissant takes out all his issues on Biscotti. Peanut gets her memory back when she tries to go to the bathroom.

programme.title: The Mistakes We Make
programme.desc: Croissant is revisited by his vision and learns to let go. Pain Au Chocolat confronts her love head on. Peanut finds Donut and the two have an explosive reconnection.

programme.title: Why is Weed Illegal?
programme.desc: The Fade combines highs with history to give you the uncensored truth behind cannabis and prohibition.

programme.title: Episode 2 - Creative
programme.desc: The creative angle to event production is what has always separated Farechild from the pack of other producers. Being able to take a theme and find creative elements to make the theme come alive, is one aspect of production that is never overlooked by the Farechild team. Watch as they take a simple idea and start the creative process to build a logo and brand identity for the party.

programme.title: Volume 6 - Dr. Sherry Yafai
programme.desc: Dr. Sherry Yafai is a Cannabis and Emergency Medicine physician at Providence St. John's Medical Center since 2009. Dr. Yafai opened her private Cannabis Clinic, the ReLeaf Institute, where she sees patients referred by physicians for cannabis education and treatment. Roughly 75% of her patients are over the age of 50 and prefer to use non-smokable Cannabis products.

programme.title: Field Trip
programme.desc: Join Jordyn, Steph, Tammy, and special guests for another episode of Field Trip.

programme.title: Krayzie Bone
programme.desc: Jared Mirsky talks with Krayzie Bone, an American rapper, singer, producer, entrepreneur, and member of the rap group Bone Thugs-n-Harmony.

programme.title: Ep 9 - Lucy Parsons - Labor Rights Activist
programme.desc: Labor Rights activist Lucy Parsons fights the oppressive capitalist system against racism, sexism and classism.

programme.title: Volume 5 - Elliot Lewis
programme.desc: Not all heroes wear capes! CEO, industry insider, activist, and entreprenuer Elliot Lewis puts his money and his actions where his mouth is. The Long Beach native leads a daily charge fighting for what's fair and right for the industry. His mission to promote Weed For The People has brought about positive changes in local tax codes, employee rights, and access to top products at affordable prices.

programme.title: Ep 8 - Josephine Baker - Iconic entertainer
programme.desc: Performer Josephine Baker becomes the toast of Europe and a spy for the French during World War II.

programme.desc: Athlete Annette Kellerman gets arrested for wearing a man’s bathing suit and invents a functional women’s bathing suit.

programme.title: Luis Jimenez
programme.desc: Award-winning chef Brandin LaShae is put to the test when friends show up with a bag of groceries, no recipe, and cannabis. Together, they attempt to craft a perfect Pot Pie.

programme.title: Top 5 Presidents That Smoked Weed
programme.desc: The Fade combines highs with history to give you the uncensored truth behind cannabis and prohibition.

programme.title: Motherhood
programme.desc: The Nest with Missy Modell brings together some of the most influential women in entertainment and business to delve into hot and often taboo topics effecting females in the modern world.

programme.title: MishCatt - Your Eyes (Official Video)
programme.desc: Check out the official music video for Your Eyes by MishCatt.

programme.title: Welcoming Cannamaste Founders Chris Conrad & Mikki Norris
programme.desc: “Inhale and pass it on. Cannamaste.“ Cannatheism, is a global religious community that is united by a single belief: Cannabis is a Sacrament in the lives its its adherents. Began as a religious defense in 1995 by cannabis expert witness and legal consultant, Chris Conrad, alongside his partner and American drug policy activist, former publisher, and author, Mikki Norris, Cantheism does not discriminate against core religious beliefs. Christian, Hindu, Muslim, Jew, Atheist, Skeptic, Anamist, Pantheist and all faiths are welcome to congregate and share sacrament with others who receive cannabis in thanksgiving and prayer.

programme.title: The History of Visionary Art: Meaning and Importance Today with Jake Kobrin
programme.desc: Join artist Jake Kobrin for a deep dive into the history, meaning, and significance of visionary art.

programme.title: I Am My Own Laboratory
programme.desc: In the early 1970’s, 23 year old Amanda Feilding, Countess of Wemyss and March, drilled a hole in her head — that is she trepanned herself. Now 74, Amanda is a leader of the renaissance in scientific psychedelic research.

programme.title: Consciousness Explorers: The Basis for Nowhere Mind
programme.desc: An examination of Robert Monroe's out-of-body experience

programme.title: The Art of Life
programme.desc: Michael is a mathematical genius. He sees complex patterns where others cannot. Yet emotionally he can't handle society. So he created a life that most people would not think possible, where science and spirituality merged, and made friends with dolphins.

programme.title: Breaking Leaves
programme.desc: In the Haitian countryside – where people have little access to doctors, hospitals, or conventional medicine - peasants use local leaves, herbs and therapeutic massage as a way of curing simple ailments. Narrated by the people themselves.

programme.title: The Ayahuasca Experience
programme.desc: A short documentary exploring Ayahuasca, offering a unique insight into the mystical self-healing experience. Follow Charmaine as she takes a journey into an expanded state of consciousness. Witness what it's like to take part in an ayahuasca ceremony.

programme.title: How to Roll a Joint
programme.desc: Can you fit a full eighth into one paper? It takes practice, concentration, skill and love. Just ask Swami Chaitanya, founder of Swami Select. He's been mastering the craft of mega joint rolling for years.

programme.title: The Wrong Rock
programme.desc: A tale of equality told through the epic adventure of a mushroom.

programme.title: The Scale of Things
programme.desc: Have you ever wondered how large the universe is? Whilst it is still unknown, it looks very likely that our universe is infinite, but what about the possibility of infinity in both directions. Has science found a limit to how small things really can be?

programme.title: DocoBanksy
programme.desc: DocoBanksy finds the truths and explores the impact that the world’s most famous graffiti artist has had on the art world, on the expression of protest and satire, and on the perception of what you can do with a spray can and a stencil.

programme.title: Just to Get a Rep
programme.desc: The true story of the origins of graffiti and hip-hop, featuring interviews with NYC's legendary spray-paint pioneers – plus today's leading artists.

programme.title: Security Measures
programme.desc: After robbers steal all of last years' crops, Jackie and Stang decide to beef up security measures to prevent another heist. They celebrate the 4th of July on the farm and install fencing and security cameras. But as wildfires tear through Northern California, a whole new set of problems emerge.

programme.title: Aradale Lunatic Asylum
programme.desc: A building once home to pre-frontal lobotomies and electro-shock therapy, Aradale Asylum delivers misery and paranormal activity in enormous doses.

programme.title: Ghosts of Europe
programme.desc: Six explorers from Australia investigate hauntings in some of the most controversial locations in Europe. From an abandoned school near Chernobyl in the Ukraine to a Castle and a deserted orphanage in Central Europe. Do things really go bump in the night?

programme.title: Ep. 14 - The Untold History: How Africa Brought Cannabis to the Americas
programme.desc: A new generation of academic researchers with a focus on cannabis are breaking ground in our understanding of the origins and migration of cannabis across the globe. Experts in the fields of history, geography, anthropology, and archaeology are uncovering new findings on how people of all cultures integrated cannabis in their societies. Chris Duvall is a professor of Geography at the University of New Mexico and he is the author of, The African Roots of Marijuana. His research is opening a new perspective on how cannabis comes to Africa and spreads across the continent. Centuries of lost history are coming to light because of Chris's diligent research. Aspiring academics with a passion for cannabis will not want to miss this episode.

programme.title: Wellness

programme.title: Ep. 8 - New Mexico, New York, and U.K.

RFC also brings two correspondent reports from newly legal cannabis states; New Mexico and New York. Hear about the latest news reports from around on the UK's challenge for common sense cannabis reform, prohibitionists attempts to impose THC cap limits and the San Francisco social equity program.

programme.title: Welcoming Cannamaste Founders Chris Conrad & Mikki Norris
programme.desc: “Inhale and pass it on. Cannamaste.“ Cannatheism, is a global religious community that is united by a single belief: Cannabis is a Sacrament in the lives its its adherents. Began as a religious defense in 1995 by cannabis expert witness and legal consultant, Chris Conrad, alongside his partner and American drug policy activist, former publisher, and author, Mikki Norris, Cantheism does not discriminate against core religious beliefs. Christian, Hindu, Muslim, Jew, Atheist, Skeptic, Anamist, Pantheist and all faiths are welcome to congregate and share sacrament with others who receive cannabis in thanksgiving and prayer.

programme.title: Tyla Yaweh and Chris Crayzie
programme.desc: Welcome to Dab Roast Episode 3 of Season 1! In this episode, your host who dabs the most, Chris Crayzie, interviews the hip-hop up-and-comer Tyla Yaweh. Listen to Tyla talk about what it’s like working with Post Malone as the superstar’s debut artist and how good the TikTok fame that came from the popularity of his single, “Stuntin’ On You,” feels. Hear Tyla talk about the “king of the double-threat” in singing and rapping, his views on Birdman’s legal woes with Lil Wayne, and his plans to go into the cannabis industry much like Wiz Khalifa before him. Watch as Tyla Yaweh pays his respects to the king of underground hip-hop, MF Doom — all while taking dab after dab like a champ!

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Charlamagne Tha God
programme.desc: DL’s featured guest on DL Uncut is one of the hosts on the nationally syndicated radio show The Breakfast Club – Charlamagne Tha God.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Flavor Flav
programme.desc: Guest on DL Uncut is rapper and tv personality Flavor Flav. Flav was an original member of the ground-breaking rap group Public Enemy. DL and Flav discuss the origins of Public Enemy music and the importance of it today. Flav also shares his thoughts on politics and how it affects people.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Comedian Sinbad
programme.desc: DL Hughley Uncut on GFNTV. Guest on DL Uncut is comedian and actor Sinbad. He became known in the 1990s from being featured on his own HBO specials, appearing on several television series, and starring in numerous films. Sinbad never tells jokes but rather stalks the stage, telling real-life stories.He doesn’t write his material; he relives it as he remembers it.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Matt Barnes
programme.desc: Guest on DL Uncut is former NBA star and 2017 NBA Champion Matt Barnes. Matt discusses his upbringing, thoughts on now legalized marijuana. Matt also gives his thoughts on George Floyd and the affects on our society.

programme.title: GFNTV Live Presents Snoop Dogg
programme.desc: Hip Hop Superstar Snoop Dogg performing live.

programme.title: The Untold Story Of Rakim: Part One
programme.desc: A two part documentary about the story of Rakim. In-depth insights from those who were closest to the creative lyrical mastermind of Rakim.

programme.title: The Untold Story Of Rakim: Part Two
programme.desc: Check Out My Melody Part 2 - A two part documentary about the story of Rakim. In-depth insights from those who were closest to the creative lyrical mastermind of Rakim.

programme.title: GFNTV Live Presents Maysa
programme.desc: Jazz singer Maysa performs live at the Gateway Jazz Festival.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Alonzo Bodden
programme.desc: Guest on DL Uncut is standup comedian and former “Last Comic Standing” champion Alonzo Bodden. DL and Alonzo discuss the issues of the pandemic and working as entertainers. They also discuss politics, racism, and other issues in the black community.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest David A. Arnold
programme.desc: Guest on DL Uncut is stand-up comedian, writer and producer David Arnold. He has a special on Netflix called “Fat Ballerina”.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Dondre Whitfield
programme.desc: DL’s featured guest on DL Uncut is actor and author Dondre Whitfield. Dondre Whitfield began his career in a recurring role on the NBC sitcom “The Cosby Show”. He’s appeared in soap operas, winning three Daytime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Younger Actor. He’s been in numerous sitcoms and films. Whitfield currently stars in the show Queen Sugar.

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Actor Miguel A. Nunez

programme.title: DL Hughley Uncut - Guest Atty Ben Crump
programme.desc: DL Hughley Uncut on GFNTV. Guest on DL Uncut is Civil Rights Attorney Benjamin Crump. Attorney Crump is best known for taking on the toughest cases with national civil rights implications. From Trayvon Martin to Michael Brown, Crump continues to push the envelope for justice for those whose lives have been changed due an unfair legal system.

programme.title: Play To Win- Episode
programme.desc: "Play To Win" pits a group of contestants from around the world against one another for a chance to compete for a life-changing job or a six-figure coaching opportunity with the HIGDON GROUP.

programme.title: Play To Win- Episode
programme.desc: In this episode contestants not only travel from the other side of the world to compete - but they overcome some of the most horrific stories you will ever hear in your life.

programme.title: Play To Win- Episode
programme.desc: This episode is all about HOW to demonstrate your worth and we've never seen so many people pour themselves out and completely rebuild like we saw in this episode.

programme.title: Play To Win- Episode
programme.desc: Getting attention for yourself or for a product is one of the most difficult things you will ever be faced with. We devised a unique marketing challenge unlike any of the previous episodes.

programme.title: Play To Win- Episode
programme.desc: Thousands applied. 40 of the best people were picked and 8 people earned the right to compete for the Grand Prize. Which ONE of them actually Plays to WIN?

programme.title: Meditations for Manifestation - Obstacles
programme.desc: True faith is a valuable ally when facing obstacles.

programme.title: Essential Oils with Gina Nostrant and Guest Siddiqa Salter
programme.desc: Everything is energy. Energy is vibrating at a certain frequency. When we are vibrating on a high frequency....good things such as happy relationships, excellent health, success and abundance just show up in our lives. This show will include interviews an

programme.title: EP 1 - Location Location Location
programme.desc: Meet the contestants and learn the first of Brian’s 5 step House Hacking formula.

programme.title: EP 2 - Other People's Property
programme.desc: Learn why using properties you don’t own can be so lucrative.

programme.title: EP 3 - We Have Company
programme.desc: The contestants prepare to make a place livable before guests arrive.

programme.title: EP 4 - Flip the Switch
programme.desc: It’s time to make the property listing live on the site and accept bookings.

programme.title: EP 5 - The Finale
programme.desc: Find out which contestant is named the winner and becomes Brian’s new business partner.

programme.title: Stepdads The Sketch- Ep 1
programme.desc: When infidelity claims the life of Joanne Bates, her children Lisa and Stevie are left in the custody of her fiancé Mike and his brother Jerry. Mike, a straight-laced, hardworking accountant; and Jerry, a wild, unstable, womanizer were both former foster children and together they provide a unique balance of parenting skills for young Lisa and Stevie. - Step Dads starring Ben Sloane (R.I.P.D, Alpha House), Morocco Omari (Empire, 21 Bridges, Homeland, Chicago Fire), Jorie Binion (Chicago P.D) Charles Dunlap (Chicago Fire, Empire), and Jay Davis (Not Another Black Movie, Choke On That: The Series, Not Another Zombie Movie) is a comedy about two polar opposite foster brothers raising two children using non-traditional parenting methods while shedding a satirical light on the importance of adoption. We poke fun at some of the mishaps which comes along with the shock of being a new parent, but ultimately, we hope to spread awareness on adoption, the importance of having fathers and father-figures in the lives of young people, and having a familial loving environment. The moral of our story is that “No family is perfect, but every child deserves to be loved unconditionally, and raised in a reliable, stable support system.”

programme.title: Space Channel News Special
programme.desc: Space Channel recaps the historic SpaceX I4 mission, the FAA may be getting closer to giving Starship and green light, cracks on the ISS and a new Russia-Saudi Arabian partnership. Also spotlights on ISS astronauts.

programme.title: Elon can't help but help
programme.desc: From water crises, ventilators and cave diving, Elon Musk, founder of Tesla and SpaceX just can't help but help.

programme.title: The Art of Space
programme.desc: Midwest-Modernist designer with prints and apparel to help show off your inner Scientist 🔬, Explorer 🚀, Physicist ⚛️ and Geek 🤓

programme.title: Space Time and Design
programme.desc: A series of science, physics and space posters providing a beautiful and accessible approach towards subjects and theories that were so much bigger than ourselves to provide a way to celebrate the science that created them.

programme.title: Inspiration 4 splashdown update
programme.desc: Inspiration 4 has landed, the four amateur astronauts aboard this SpaceX Dragon Spacecraft have made history. Successfully completing the first all civilian mission to orbit the Earth.

programme.title: SpaceX FAA update
programme.desc: The four Astronauts aboard the Inspiration 4 are catching their breath, after a successful 3 day mission orbiting the Earth. Meanwhile SpaceX founders, Elon Musk maybe catching his breath too, but for different reasons.

programme.title: Micah Walter-Range & New Space Economy
programme.desc: Space Channel has an in-depth interview with Micah Walter Range, President of Caelus Partnerrs. Topics covered, progression of the commercial space industry, militarization of space and potential for conflict.

programme.title: Space Channel News
programme.desc: Updates on the New Space Race, FAA and SpaceX and cracks on the ISS

programme.title: New Space
programme.desc: A journey to new space through visuals, music, new, movies and more.

programme.title: Space Channel Exclusive- I4's Dr. Sian Proctor
programme.desc: Dr. Proctor is a geoscientist, explorer, space artist, and astronaut. She is the mission pilot for the Inspiration4 all-civilian orbital mission to space. She is also one of The Explorer’s Club 50: Fifty People Changing the World. Her motto is called Space2inspire where she encourages people to use their unique, one-of-a-kind strengths, and passion to inspire those within their reach and beyond. She believes that we need to actively strive for a J.E.D.I. space: a just, equitable, diverse, and inclusive space as we advance human spaceflight.

programme.title: Mars Update
programme.desc: History is in the making as the United States, China and United Arab Emirates all set their sites on Mars. New technology and new hope for the future will all be on display. Space Channel gives an overview of each mission and the latest updates.

programme.desc: Midwest-Modernist designer with prints and apparel to help show off your inner Scientist 🔬, Explorer 🚀, Physicist ⚛️ and Geek 🤓

programme.title: Space Time and Design
programme.desc: A series of science, physics and space posters providing a beautiful and accessible approach towards subjects and theories that were so much bigger than ourselves to provide a way to celebrate the science that created them.

programme.title: Inspiration 4 splashdown update
programme.desc: Inspiration 4 has landed, the four amateur astronauts aboard this SpaceX Dragon Spacecraft have made history. Successfully completing the first all civilian mission to orbit the Earth.

programme.title: SpaceX FAA update
programme.desc: The four Astronauts aboard the Inspiration 4 are catching their breath, after a successful 3 day mission orbiting the Earth. Meanwhile SpaceX founders, Elon Musk maybe catching his breath too, but for different reasons.

programme.title: Micah Walter-Range & New Space Economy
programme.desc: Space Channel has an in-depth interview with Micah Walter Range, President of Caelus Partnerrs. Topics covered, progression of the commercial space industry, militarization of space and potential for conflict.

programme.title: Space Channel News
programme.desc: Updates on the New Space Race, FAA and SpaceX and cracks on the ISS

programme.title: Space Channel Exclusive- I4's Dr. Sian Proctor
programme.desc: Dr. Proctor is a geoscientist, explorer, space artist, and astronaut. She is the mission pilot for the Inspiration4 all-civilian orbital mission to space. She is also one of The Explorer’s Club 50: Fifty People Changing the World. Her motto is called Space2inspire where she encourages people to use their unique, one-of-a-kind strengths, and passion to inspire those within their reach and beyond. She believes that we need to actively strive for a J.E.D.I. space: a just, equitable, diverse, and inclusive space as we advance human spaceflight.

programme.title: Mars Update
programme.desc: History is in the making as the United States, China and United Arab Emirates all set their sites on Mars. New technology and new hope for the future will all be on display. Space Channel gives an overview of each mission and the latest updates.

programme.title: Europa
programme.desc: Discovering and exploring Jupiter's most promising moon, Europa. Europa was named after a Phoenician noblewoman who was abducted by Zeus after he had transformed himself into a bull. Rather fittingly, Zeus established Europa on the island of Crete as its queen, where he had several children with her, including Minos, the legendary king of Crete. In later ages, the continent of Europe would be named after Europa.

programme.title: Space Channel Exclusive- I4's Dr. Sian Proctor
programme.desc: Dr. Proctor is a geoscientist, explorer, space artist, and astronaut. She is the mission pilot for the Inspiration4 all-civilian orbital mission to space. She is also one of The Explorer’s Club 50: Fifty People Changing the World. Her motto is called Space2inspire where she encourages people to use their unique, one-of-a-kind strengths, and passion to inspire those within their reach and beyond. She believes that we need to actively strive for a J.E.D.I. space: a just, equitable, diverse, and inclusive space as we advance human spaceflight.

programme.title: Space Channel News Special
programme.desc: Space Channel recaps the historic SpaceX I4 mission, the FAA may be getting closer to giving Starship and green light, cracks on the ISS and a new Russia-Saudi Arabian partnership. Also spotlights on ISS astronauts.

programme.title: Encore of Space Channel's Virgin Galactic Launch Coverage
programme.desc: Space Channel host Jamie Holmes and a roundtable of space industry experts cover the launch of Virgin Galactic's Unity 22 mission, featuring Richard Branson going to space.

programme.title: Space Channel Special Presentation-Autonomous Swarms
programme.desc: Space Channel Interviews Cal State Northridge's Dr. Nhut Ho, Autonomy Research Center and Professor of Mechanical Engineering a out autonomous drone swarms to be used in space and planetary exploration.

programme.title: Mission Recap of SpaceX's Inspiration 4
programme.desc: Encore presentation of Space Channel's live coverage from its Space Coast studios of the historic Inspiration 4 launch.

programme.title: Space Channel News Special
programme.desc: Space Channel covers the latest news, explores what is...Space For Humanity and more.

programme.title: Jupiter
programme.desc: Jupiter is the fifth planet from our Sun and is, by far, the largest planet in the solar system – more than twice as massive as all the other planets combined. Jupiter’s stripes and swirls are actually cold, windy clouds of ammonia and water, floating in an atmosphere of hydrogen and helium. Jupiter’s iconic Great Red Spot is a giant storm bigger than Earth that has raged for hundreds of years.

programme.title: Space Channel Universe
programme.desc: Join us as we travel through the Space Channel Universe and experience the Final Frontier like never before.

programme.title: SpacedOUT! with Sarah Begum
programme.desc: After exploring remote corners of Planet Earth, living with indigenous tribes, surviving dangerous slums and working with societal skyscrapers, Sarah has taken her adventurous missions to a whole new level as she looks to the sky and space for her next phase of exploration. Maybe she is the one to make contact with alien civilizations? Or unearth and pioneer new discoveries and developments within the space industry. Find out...

programme.title: United States Space Summit
programme.desc: US Chamber of Commerce brings on specials guest to explore the state of the national and international space industry and its implications for the future.

programme.title: Mission Recap of SpaceX's Inspiration 4
programme.desc: Encore presentation of Space Channel's live coverage from its Space Coast studios of the historic Inspiration 4 launch.

programme.title: Space Tourist - The First Space Hotel
programme.desc: Space Tourist takes us out of this world to a company making plans to build a hotel in space as well as those closer to home.

programme.title: Blue Origin Live Stream Replay
programme.desc: Space Channel's Encore Presentation of coverage of the Blue Origin Launch, hosted by Jamie Holmes and a distinguished panel of experts.

programme.title: Escape into Nature
programme.desc: Enjoy natural videos and sounds, set to music. No narration - find your own magic in nature. Take a deep breath, relax, and drift into a calm far off and healing place.

programme.title: Sea Forest
programme.desc: Freedivers explore the underwater forest LIVE from Cape Town while a land based expert explains what we are seeing.

programme.desc: If you missed the LIVE show then catch up here with the unfolding story of a group of penguins who live on a beach in South Africa.

programme.title: Escape into Nature
programme.desc: Enjoy natural videos and sounds, set to music. No narration - find your own magic in nature. Take a deep breath, relax, and drift into a calm far off and healing place.

programme.title: Samoa: Tattoo Heritage
programme.desc: The tattooing practiced in Samoa is not comparable to the fashionable trend in Europe. In Samoa, tattooing is above all a rite signifying that the individual belongs to a group, and it is extremely painful. The more painful it is, the more Stivi approaches the state of a real, accomplished man.

programme.title: Haiti: The Carnival of Specters
programme.desc: Every year in Jacmel, on the southern coast of Haiti, festivities take on an intensity not found elsewhere. Haitians do not depict dream-like characters in their parades, but instead, monsters or specters. This is a way for them to deal with the difficulties of the past, and those of the present.

programme.title: Savannah
programme.desc: We visit the old South and enjoy some sweet tea in Savannah. On this episode, we will stroll the city’s beautiful squares, as well as visit its civil war past at Old Fort Jackson. Then, we head up the stairs of the famous Tybee Island lighthouse and visit the Savannah Railroad museum.

programme.title: Best Parks for Jaw Dropping Scenery
programme.desc: See Mother Nature at its best. From the highest waterfall to the one of the biggest holes in the world, it's this kind of scenery that will make you stop in your tracks.

programme.title: Lonely Planet: Best Parks Ever - America's National Parks
programme.desc: With acres of sea lions and thousands of buffalo, national parks host the largest homes to all kinds of critters. Get close to your favorite animal in this episode of Best Parks Ever.

programme.title: Belize
programme.desc: Un-Belizable! We are off on a Central American Mayan excursion. We head up the steps of the ancient high temple at Lamanai. Then we take a city tour of the main tourist destination, Belize City. We learn about Belize's colonial roots at the Belize City History Museum and dive the amazing Blue Hole.

programme.title: Running of the Bulls
programme.desc: The Festival of San Fermin in Pamplona, Spain is a deeply rooted celebration of traditional and folkloric events, including the Running of the Bulls. Experience the incredible energy each morning for eight consecutive days as thousands of people run ahead of six, 2,000-pound charging bulls.

programme.title: S9E1 - Oaxaca's Most Magical Holiday
programme.desc: Rick takes us on a remarkable journey through Oaxaca City during the revered Dia de Los Muertos (Day of the Dead) holiday. Much preparation for the celebration takes place in October, and Rick gives us an insider’s look at the fiesta.

programme.title: S9E2 - Oaxaca's Live-Fire Cooking
programme.desc: Everything tastes better when cooked over a fire, at least that is the Oaxacan credo. From soup to barbacoa, fiery embers influence the flavor of Oaxaca’s food in just the right ways. Join Rick in Oaxaca, San Felipe Usila, and Zaachilla.

programme.title: S9E3 - Off the Beaten Path in Huatulco
programme.desc: Mexico's beaches glimmer with pristine perfection. Chef Rick Bayless takes us off the beaten path to find great food and even better beaches such as Playa Chahue and Playa Principal. You would be well-advised to follow his lead.

programme.title: S9E4 - Artisan Mescal
programme.desc: Mescal is experiencing a renaissance in Mexico and throughout the United States. Journey with Rick to witness firsthand how an Oaxacan distiller handcrafts this fine spirit renowned for its rich, smoky complexity and brightness.

programme.title: S9E5 - Oaxaca, the Land of Seven Moles
programme.desc: So many moles, so little time. Rick will focus on two moles while visiting the Seasons of My Heart Cooking School on the outskirts of Oaxaca City to explore Black Mole and Green Mole with school owner Susana Trilling and her students.

programme.title: S9E6 - Delicious Eco-Tourism
programme.desc: Ever on a quest to learn more about food, Rick even vacations with a food-oriented agenda. Join him in the mountains of Finca Las Nieves, with its artisanal coffee production and organic gardens, and learn about sustainable gardening.

programme.title: S9E7 - The Kernel of Deliciousness
programme.desc: The variety of corns available in Oaxaca boggles the mind and the taste buds. Rick introduces us to Amado Ramirez Leyva who believes that corn, domesticated some 9,000 years ago in Mexico, represents the very foundation of Mexican culture.

programme.title: S9E8 - Mercado Madness
programme.desc: “You are what you eat.” Brillat Savarin’s statement fuels Rick’s tour of the 21 de Noviembre market in downtown Oaxaca. We uncover the incredibly rich culture of the market and its role in the daily lives and meals of the local population.

programme.title: S9E9 - Oaxacan Cheese Primer
programme.desc: In Mexico, cheese is all about freshness, and fresh cheese is exactly what Rick has found in the village of Rojas where he and two local women turn uber-fresh milk from alfalfa-fed cows into queso fresco and salty quesillo (string cheese).

programme.title: S9E10 - Puerto Escondido: Living the Dream
programme.desc: Ever dream of renting a space with a kitchen in Mexico just to cook all the fresh fish you can eat? Rick lives the dream at Hotel Villas Carrizalillo in Puerto Escondido. With few culinary tools, and fresh ingredients, it is time to feast.

programme.title: S9E11 - Chocolate & Coffee from Bean to Cup
programme.desc: In Mexico, hot chocolate and coffee are equally enjoyed. The Seasons of My Heart Cooking School explains the roasting process from two perspectives, while the Finca Las Nieves Coffee Plantation offers a look into organic coffee production.

programme.title: S9E12 - Bringing Oaxaca Home
programme.desc: The once unknown state of Oaxaca is now on the savvy traveler’s hit list. Its capital is one of Mexico’s most enjoyable colonial cities. Rick takes the spirit of Oaxaca home, and with a group of friends, creates a dinner sure to transport.

programme.title: Havana's Spirit
programme.desc: Cuban ingenuity and creativity are alive in Cuba’s capital of Havana, a UNESCO World Heritage Site. A leading site for fashion and music, Havana is reconnecting with its past as a starlet. Santiago de Cuba, the birthplace of Cuban music, is also featured. Experience “La Cubania.”

programme.title: Inner Worlds
programme.desc: What other country has eaten organic food for the past 20 years, has derived 30% of its energy from renewable sources, is a pioneer in ecotourism, and has a Ministry for Climate Change? The answer is, Cuba, with 263 protected areas, including six UNESCO World Biosphere Reserves.

programme.title: Lets Get Lost
programme.desc: Jumping into a Thai tuk tuk taxi, Tony attempts to soak up Thai culture, and get lost in the cuisine of Chiang Mai, Thailand.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Explore Las Vegas’ lesser known past. We visit the National Atomic Testing museum to learn about how the desert outside of Vegas was used for testing America’s secret nuclear weapons. We also visit the Mormon Fort, the first permanent non-native settlement in the area, as well as the Neon Museum.

programme.title: S7E7 - Paris: Embracing Life and Art
programme.desc: We'll ride a unicorn into the Middle Ages at Paris’ Cluny Museum, get a heavenly look at stained glass in Sainte-Chapelle, go on a tombstone pilgrimage at Pere Lachaise Cemetery, and savor the Parisian cafe scene.

programme.title: Disney Animal Kingdom
programme.desc: Explore the process of designing and creating Disney’s Animal Kingdom with incredible behind-the-scenes footage. Discover how Disney incorporates live animals into their attractions and uncover the time taken to create authentic habitats that allow visitors to experience a safari or jungle trek.

programme.title: Switzerlands Amazing Train Rides
programme.desc: Join host Jeff Wilson and PBS award-winning photographers and ride through a Swiss Alps train adventure. The wonders of the Alps exhilarate travelers as you travel through stunning scenic routes and the iconic Matterhorn, a 14,600-foot peak that overlooks the charming town of Zermatt, Switzerland.

programme.title: S8E2 - Tijuana Taco Crawl
programme.desc: Three local Tijuana foodies take Rick on a taco crawl. Experience arrachera tacos, suadero tacos, sauteed and fried shrimp tacos, steamed tacos, and smoked salmon tacos. At home, Rick creates a taco feast for a casual backyard cookout.

programme.title: Darwin Northern Territory
programme.desc: In Darwin, Jason swims in the Crocodile Tank and visits Litchfield National Park. He also goes heli-pubbing, savours the delicious barra burger, then catches, and cooks, black pepper mud crab. Delicious!

programme.title: Dining With Geishas
programme.desc: Rural Japan: Tony decides to look for a more relaxing, traditional Japanese culinary experience in the countryside. Tony travels to an old-style Japanese inn that specializes in kaiseki cuisine, ancient tea ceremony, and local ingredients.

programme.title: Renaissance Europe
programme.desc: Travelers adore Italy, and Italy adores the Renaissance. In this historical half-hour, we follow Western Europe's transitiical sites and museums in favor of a trip--or a day--just for fun.

programme.title: Europe's Getaways
programme.desc: A key attraction of travel on any continent, including Europe, is that 30 minutes outside any city exists a getaway unlike any you will find on the globe. Truly unique locations that resonate with history and significance. Here, we explore a few such places.

programme.title: Ireland's West Coast
programme.desc: Our trip to Ireland's west coast begins in Galway, Europe's fastest growing city, shopping for Irish crystal and Celtic jewelry. Then it is a salt-sprayed trip to the fabled Aran Islands where we reach breathless heights at a Stone Age fort and ferret out traditional hand-knit sweaters.

programme.title: Dublin and Beyond
programme.desc: Irish eyes are smiling when we explore Dublin, Ireland's urban core. There is history around every corner, and Dublin delights with Trinity College, the Book of Kells, the famous Guinness Brewery, and the infamous Kilmainham jail where Irish rebels spent their last days.

programme.title: Germany's Romantic Road
programme.desc: The Romantic Road winds through some of Germany's most picturesque countryside complete with medieval villages and Baroque Palaces. We start our journey in Wurzburg where we visit the spectacular Baroque Bishop's Palace or Residenz and taste wine at one of Wurzburg's many wine festivals.

programme.title: Darwin Northern Territory
programme.desc: In Darwin, Jason swims in the Crocodile Tank and visits Litchfield National Park. He also goes heli-pubbing, savours the delicious barra burger, then catches, and cooks, black pepper mud crab. Delicious!

programme.title: Dining With Geishas
programme.desc: Rural Japan: Tony decides to look for a more relaxing, traditional Japanese culinary experience in the countryside. Tony travels to an old-style Japanese inn that specializes in kaiseki cuisine, ancient tea ceremony, and local ingredients.

programme.title: S8E1 - Mediterranean Baja
programme.desc: The Baja California peninsula boasts a climate reminiscent of the Mediterranean Sea. Rick makes tacos with ingredients from the gardens of the Rancho La Puerta spa, and meets up with Chefs Miguel Angel Guerrero Yagues and Jair Tellez.

programme.title: S8E2 - Tijuana Taco Crawl
programme.desc: Three local Tijuana foodies take Rick on a taco crawl. Experience arrachera tacos, suadero tacos, sauteed and fried shrimp tacos, steamed tacos, and smoked salmon tacos. At home, Rick creates a taco feast for a casual backyard cookout.

programme.title: S8E3 - Cooking on the Sea of Cortez
programme.desc: Rick is always up for a cooking challenge, and after a day on the waters of the Sea of Cortez, Rick grills dinner for the group on the beach of Espiritu Santo Island. To stock up on supplies Rick shops in the La Paz market for ingredients.

programme.title: S8E4 - Presenting: World-Class Wines of Baja
programme.desc: Join Rick and winemaker Hugo d’Acosta as they toast the world-class wines of Baja California Norte. Hugo first introduces Rick his Casa de Piedra wines before moving on to Tres Mujeres, L.A. Cetto, and the San Rafael Winery.

programme.title: S8E5 - Eat Like a Local in Los Cabos
programme.desc: Ever travel to a tourist mecca and wonder what the locals eat? Join Rick and his friend Hugo to find the best Mexican food in Los Cabos. First stop is the municipal market in San Jose del Cabo, then they enjoy carnitas at Los Michoacanos.

programme.title: S8E6 - A Delicious Feast in Magdalena Bay
programme.desc: Rick and local guide Luis Garduno of REDTours venture out on a skiff to learn about sustainable fishing on Magdalena Bay. They catch up with local lobster fishermen and clam divers and follow that up with shore lunch on Isla de Magdalena.

programme.title: Ocho Rios, Jamaica
programme.desc: Donna visits Ocho Rios, Jamaica and explores the history, culture, adventure, and an amazing family-focused resort. She also highlights a wonderful Jam-Italian fusion restaurant that is a MUST when visiting Ocho Rios.

programme.title: Sea Change
programme.desc: Fresh water is one of Earth’s sacred resources. Lake Turkana’s freshwater resources are vital to countless people who rely on it for sustenance. When a dam threatened to disturb the Lake’s ecosystem, some took action to protect their home.

programme.title: From Peru to Tanzania
programme.desc: There are places on Earth worthy of absolute preservation and protection for all future generations. Meet people from Puerto Rico, Maryland, Peru, Tanzania, Slovakia, and Cambodia who all share an abiding belief in a sacred, healthy Earth.

programme.title: Portugal's Via Publicae
programme.desc: Open your ears to those who call this land home, and who will unveil its unique characteristics to you. Via Publicae was once an ancient Roman road and trade route that stretched from Braga in the north to Lisbon in the south of Portugal. Roman influence was once very strong in this region.

programme.title: The Volga, Soul of Russia
programme.desc: The Volga River, also called "matuschka,” welcomes world travelers on giant boats. Take a journey of 4,000 kilometers towards the Caspian Sea, from Moscow to Astrakhan, through Laroslav, Nijini Novgorod, Kazan, Samara, and Saratov.

programme.title: A Taste of Tokyo
programme.desc: Anthony travels to Tokyo, where he begins in the Tsujiki market and then is introduced to techniques in preparing edomae sushi. He also learns the diets of Sumo wrestlers.

programme.title: Dining With Geishas
programme.desc: Rural Japan: Tony decides to look for a more relaxing, traditional Japanese culinary experience in the countryside. Tony travels to an old-style Japanese inn that specializes in kaiseki cuisine, ancient tea ceremony, and local ingredients.

programme.title: S7E1 - Rome: Ancient Glory
programme.desc: Focusing on the grandeur of classical Rome, we’ll marvel at the Colosseum, Pantheon, and Capitoline Museum before heading out on a bike ride along the ancient Appian Way.

programme.title: S8E1 - Western Turkey
programme.desc: After kicking off in Kusadası, we wander ancient Ephesus, soak in a natural spa at Pamukkale, learn why dervishes whirl at Konya, and sail the Mediterranean on a "gulet" from Antalya.

programme.title: Wild Travels: America's Oddest Museums
programme.desc: Museums serve a vital purpose in preserving world culture and history, and the clever museums we visit have accomplished the same objective. Walk through the doors of history and visit America’s oddest museums with your host Will Clinger.

programme.title: Wild Travels: America's Oddest Museums
programme.desc: Museums serve a vital purpose in preserving world culture and history, and the clever museums we visit have accomplished the same objective. Walk through the doors of history and visit America’s oddest museums with your host Will Clinger.

programme.title: Naples and the Amalfi Coast
programme.desc: Deep in the heart of Naples, Italy is the ideal launching point for exploring Italy's great historic treasures. Marvel at the ancient city of Pompeii, and the eerily captured devastation of Mount Vesuvius. Hop a ferry to the isle of Capri and drive the spectacular Amalfi Coast.

programme.title: Rome
programme.desc: Rudy is in the city where all roads lead - Roma. We begin in ancient Rome - the Forum, Palatine Hill, Colosseum, and the Baths of Caracalla. Then, we explore the modern city of Rome with its ambient life in the streets, cafes, pizzerias and gelaterias.

programme.title: Venice
programme.desc: Venice, the city of winding canals, decadent buildings, faith, and romance. Tour Piazza San Marco and the Basilica of San Marco. Visit a mask shop, then ship off to the islands of Murano, Burano and Torcello. Venice’s very existence, floating as if on a dream, is an amazing experience to behold.

programme.title: S8E12 - Berlin
programme.desc: While visiting Berlin's powerful sights — moving memorials, top-tier museums, surviving bits of communist and fascist days — we'll take time to revel in its vibrant social scene.

programme.title: Travel Thru History
programme.desc: In this episode we visit the Kennedy Space Center located on Florida's famous Space Coast. We will speak to NASA engineers about the past, present and future of American space travel, as well as take a look at the attractions K.S.C. has to offer.

programme.title: Miami
programme.desc: Bienvenido a Miami! We look at the history behind Florida's modern metropolis. We visit the Ancient Spanish Monastery, see the opulence of the Vizcaya Museum and Gardens, and head into the swamp to learn about the Miccosukee Indians.

programme.title: Sydney New South Wales
programme.desc: In Sydney, Jason takes part in some cooking at the award-winning Marque restaurant and meets with an up-and-coming pastry chef at The Blackstar Pastry. For some fun activities, he tries grape stomping and quad biking.

programme.title: Childhood Flavors
programme.desc: Arcachon, France: Here, Bourdain first learned to love food as a child. Returning for a trip down memory lane, Tony enjoys childhood staples, including steak frites, gaufres (waffles), soupe de pecheur (fisherman's soup) and fresh oysters.

programme.title: Walt Disney Resort Behind The Scenes
programme.desc: Since 1971, Walt Disney World has grown from a theme park and three hotels in Orlando, Florida to a vacation resort of unprecedented size and scope. Today the property encompasses four major theme parks, three water parks, 29 resort hotels, 99 holes of golf, two miniature golf courses, and more.

programme.title: Wild Travels: America's Most Unusual Festivals
programme.desc: When it is festival time, it is FUN time. Join Will Clinger and travel coast to coast to discover America’s most unique, enlightening, and unusual festivals. Get in the spirit, celebrate life, and pay homage to our shared cultural history.

programme.title: Italy: Part 1
programme.desc: Experience the arresting appeal and elegance of Italy in six select locations. Take an invigorating stroll along the Mediterranean coast in Castello Federiciano, marvel at Alberobello’s august trullo dry stone huts, and more.

programme.title: Adelaide South Australia
programme.desc: Jason visits Australia’s oldest winery in Adelaide and has a memorable dining experience in one of Australia’s top dining experiences, Restaurant Orana. For some sightseeing, he rides a bike through the sensational Barossa Valley.

programme.title: Cobra Heart-Food That Makes You Manly
programme.desc: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam: After taking a cyclo-ride through Ho Chi Minh City and trying various foods from roadside vendors and markets, Tony tests his might with a few shots of snake wine and a live cobra heart.

programme.title: Malta
programme.desc: A delightful Mediterranean climate, fantastic beaches, and fascinating historic sites only begin to describe the Maltese experience. Few places in the world possess a more exquisite coastline. The HBO series, "Game of Thrones," filmed portions of the series in Malta's capital city of Valletta.

programme.title: Dublin
programme.desc: At the confluence of Muir Eireann and the Irish Sea on Ireland’s East Coast stands the capital city of Dublin. Join Laura McKenzie as she enjoys the perfect pint at Gravity Bar atop Guinness Brewery, explore Dublin Castle, and become acquainted with The Four Seasons Dublin.

programme.title: Paris
programme.desc: There is more than enough to keep you busy in Paris. Historic sites such as the Louvre, Notre Dame Cathedral, the Picasso Museum, and Paris Opera House only get you started. Tuileries Garden and Paris Beach offer a unique way to relax and have fun, and Sacre-Coeur offers a 360-degree view of city.

programme.title: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Rent a Rolls Royce and roll through L.A. in style. When you hit Hollywood and Vine you know you are in the city’s heart, as the Pantages Theater, Capitol Records Building, Grauman's Chinese Theatre, and Kodak Theater greet you. Get the skinny on everything Beverly Hills and visit Olvera Street.

programme.title: Prague
programme.desc: Explore the heart of Bohemia as we join Laura in Prague. Visit Prague Castle, the Charles Bridge, and the Jewish Quarter. Gothic Loket Castle is a short, scenic drive away from the city and worth the tour. Next up the must-see spa town of Karlovy Vary.

programme.title: Britain's Historic Countryside
programme.desc: First stops are Camden Market and Notting Hill Gate. Enjoy a treat as Laura escorts you to the birthplace of pomp and circumstance, Buckingham Palace. Then mosey down to Windsor Castle before taking on London with Big Ben and Tower Bridge.

programme.title: Adelaide South Australia
programme.desc: Jason visits Australia’s oldest winery in Adelaide and has a memorable dining experience in one of Australia’s top dining experiences, Restaurant Orana. For some sightseeing, he rides a bike through the sensational Barossa Valley.

programme.title: Cobra Heart-Food That Makes You Manly
programme.desc: Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam: After taking a cyclo-ride through Ho Chi Minh City and trying various foods from roadside vendors and markets, Tony tests his might with a few shots of snake wine and a live cobra heart.

programme.title: S8E6 - A Delicious Feast in Magdalena Bay
programme.desc: Rick and local guide Luis Garduno of REDTours venture out on a skiff to learn about sustainable fishing on Magdalena Bay. They catch up with local lobster fishermen and clam divers and follow that up with shore lunch on Isla de Magdalena.

programme.title: S8E7 - Cooking in Wine Country
programme.desc: Ever dream of owning a winery? Don and Tru Miller made their dreams come true when they built Adobe Guadalupe. Rick’s dream of cooking in their stunning kitchen, with its handmade wood-fired oven, comes true this season. Dream on.

programme.title: S8E8 - Tijuana Round Table
programme.desc: There is a long heritage of good food in Tijuana. The city has an amazing taco, culture and is the birthplace of the Caesar salad. Today, Tijuana boasts one of the top culinary schools in the country and some of the best chefs in Mexico.

programme.title: S8E9 - Extraordinarily Delicious Ensenada
programme.desc: Fish tacos embody Ensenada’s history: Fresh fish from pristine waters encased in crispy batter influenced by Asian immigrants, topped with Spanish-inspired creamy sauces, wrapped in a very Mexican corn tortilla, and spiked with chile.

programme.title: S8E10 - Mexican Microbrews and Pub Fare
programme.desc: Many of us experienced our first Mexican beer on a beach with a squeeze of lime. Now we are happy to see a beer revolution rumbling in the Baja peninsula. Rick takes us from the Tecate brewery to the Tijuana brewery. Salud-

programme.title: S8E11 - Sustainable Aquaculture in the Rich Waters of Ensenada
programme.desc: Two of Ensenada’s best chefs, Benito Molina, and Alain Genchi, join Rick for a lesson in mollusk farming. Juan Carlos Lapuente takes the trio to the rich coastal waters to see oyster and mussel farming and learn why these waters thrive.

programme.title: Montego Bay, Jamaica
programme.desc: Donna visits Montego Bay and Negril where she will continue her journey into the heart of Jamaica. Join her as she visits the Rose Hall Great House with its mysterious past, Half Moon Resort, and takes part in cliff diving and zip lining.

programme.title: From Chicago to the Karoo
programme.desc: A healthy mind, body, and environment are all critical for living happy and productive lives. Meet pioneering people in Iraq, Colombia, South Africa, Indonesia, the United States, and Italy who believe in living symbiotically with nature.

programme.title: From Guatemala to the Congo
programme.desc: Stewardship of the land is a central part of the human condition. Unfortunately, in some cases, so is greed. Meet people from California, Congo, India, Australia, Guatemala, and Slovenia whose spirit matches their intent to live healthily.

programme.title: Germany's Via Julia
programme.desc: Discover the ancient Roman military road Via Julia that made rapid travel from Lutetia (now Paris) to Constantinople (now Istanbul) possible. Meet the people who keep the memories of this ancient route intact, and who do their utmost to keep the sacred traditions of their ancestors alive.

programme.title: The Road of Livingstone
programme.desc: “The Road of Livingstone” is a long journey in the footsteps of the British explorer David Livingstone along the Zambezi River, from its mouth in Mozambique all the way to Victoria Falls, at the border of Zambia and Zimbabwe.

programme.title: Wild Delicacies
programme.desc: Cambodia: With a friend along for the ride, Tony travels to Phnom Penh, Cambodia, where he explores a food culture that is both pleasing to the palette and slightly frightening.

programme.title: Eating on the Edge of Nowhere
programme.desc: Cambodia and Japan: Taking his obsession with the film Apocalypse Now a little too seriously, Tony sets out for Pailin, reputed to be one of the most dangerous towns on earth. After his journey, Tony returns to Japan.

programme.title: S7E2 - Rome: Baroque Brilliance
programme.desc: As we ramble through the heart of Rome, we’ll admire breathtaking Bernini statues and ponder sunbeams inside St. Peter’s Basilica. After dinner, we’ll take a nighttime stroll, lacing together the city’s piazzas and fountains.

programme.title: S8E2 - Central Turkey
programme.desc: In Turkey, we'll marvel at the fascinating landscape of Cappadocia from high above in a balloon...and from deep below, prowling an underground city where Christians once hid out.

programme.title: Wild Travels: America's Oddest Museums
programme.desc: Museums serve a vital purpose in preserving world culture and history, and the clever museums we visit have accomplished the same objective. Walk through the doors of history and visit America’s oddest museums with your host Will Clinger.

programme.title: S8E5 - Eat Like a Local in Los Cabos
programme.desc: Ever travel to a tourist mecca and wonder what the locals eat? Join Rick and his friend Hugo to find the best Mexican food in Los Cabos. First stop is the municipal market in San Jose del Cabo, then they enjoy carnitas at Los Michoacanos.

programme.title: Catalina Island
programme.desc: Catalina Island, California is a unique island off the coast of California, and Donna will take you on a journey there to revel in the island’s history, art, cuisine, and have some fun horseback riding.

programme.title: Curbside Eats
programme.desc: Join hosts Maya Norman and Katrina Kozar as they travel in an R.V. for good food, good drink, and great conversation on Curbside Eats.

programme.title: Edinburgh and Scotland
programme.desc: Friendly and feisty, Scotland makes us feel right at home. In Edinburgh, we climb the ramparts of this city's famous castle, shop for kilts, visit mysterious Rosslyn Chapel and gasp on a ghost tour. Then we head to historic St. Andrew's to practice our swing on the world's most famous golf course.

programme.title: Barcelona and Costa Brava
programme.desc: A Mediterranean marvel, Barcelona simmers with beautiful beaches, medieval mazes, eye popping art and hypnotic architecture. From tapas bars, to surrealist art, to Modernist structures, we will feast on Barcelona's delights.

programme.title: Madrid
programme.desc: The Spanish capital Madrid welcomes us with grand plazas and sparkling fountains. First stop is the Prado, one of Europe's great museums and home to Goya, El Greco and Velazquez.

programme.title: S8E11 - Prague
programme.desc: We'll visit beautifully preserved Prague to experience its massive castle, evocative Jewish Quarter, thrilling history, infectious music...and perhaps the best beer in Europe.

programme.title: Las Vegas
programme.desc: Explore Las Vegas’ lesser known past. We visit the National Atomic Testing museum to learn about how the desert outside of Vegas was used for testing America’s secret nuclear weapons. We also visit the Mormon Fort, the first permanent non-native settlement in the area, as well as the Neon Museum.

programme.title: Belize
programme.desc: Un-Belizable! We are off on a Central American Mayan excursion. We head up the steps of the ancient high temple at Lamanai. Then we take a city tour of the main tourist destination, Belize City. We learn about Belize's colonial roots at the Belize City History Museum and dive the amazing Blue Hole.

programme.title: Melbourne Victoria
programme.desc: Jason catches his own lunch at Buxton trout farm, visits a stone fruit orchard, learns how to make sausages at The Green Olive, and learns secrets of cooking from top Australian chef, Guy Grossi.

programme.title: Stuffed like a Pig
programme.desc: Portugal & Southwest France: Visiting his boss's family farm, Tony helps slaughter and feast on a pig the family has been fattening all year. Then, Tony heads to France to experience the rich delights of a foie gras farm.

programme.title: Disneyland Resort: Behind the Scenes
programme.desc: It was Walt Disney’s original vision that Disneyland would “never be completed” – always growing and changing. Decades later, Disneyland remains one of the most visited destinations on Earth. Disney Parks has proven its ability remain relevant and continue to be at the very top of the theme parks.

programme.title: The Glacier Express and Gornergrat-Bahn
programme.desc: Go sightseeing on the Glacier Express, an extraordinary railway journey high into the Swiss Alps across 291 bridges, through 91 tunnels, and across the Oberalp Pass at the highest point (2,033 meters, or 6,670 feet, above sea level), and, visit the iconic Matterhorn on the Gornergrat-Bahn.

programme.title: Shedd Aquarium: Underwater Beauty
programme.desc: Fish of all stripes and fluorescence call the crystal-clear waters of Chicago’s Shedd Aquarium home. Water and light collaborate to reveal the tranquil beauty that is life underwater.

programme.title: Perth Western Australia
programme.desc: In Western Australia, Jason visits vineyards, goes on a food adventure for crayfishes, truffles, and finger limes, and visits a Brazilian food in Perth city.

programme.title: Eating on the Mekong
programme.desc: Mekong River, Vietnam: On the river, Tony drinks a lot of Mekong moonshine with the welcoming owners of a duck farm. Although seduced by his Vietnam experience, Tony is not sure the royal dish Birds Nest Soup is all its cracked up to be.

programme.title: San Francisco
programme.desc: Stroll down Grant Street with Laura into the heart of America's largest Chinatown. Bike, drive, or walk across the Golden Gate Bridge, the city's most recognizable landmark. Finally, Fisherman's Wharf offers day trips all wrapped into one fun location.

programme.title: Versailles
programme.desc: Enter 12 miles of enclosing walls, 26 acres of roof, and over 2,000 windows and experience the royal Palace of Versailles. If you are looking for some good ole' fun, then you will enjoy Parc Asterix. Place Vendome is the top spot for high-end merchandise.

programme.title: Gold Coast Australia
programme.desc: If you like sun, surf, sand, and a laid-back lifestyle then join Laura on Australia's Gold Coast. Travel into the thick of the Queensland Rainforest, and visit the home of the largest collection of Australian native animals in the Carrumbin Wildlife Sanctuary.

programme.title: Sicily
programme.desc: Begin on the east coast in Taormina. Laura then takes us to some of Sicily's highlight cities, Palermo and Randazzo. How about a visit to Agrigento, or to the divinely inspired Cathedral Monreale? We will also visit Mt. Etna, an active volcano.

programme.title: Venice
programme.desc: Begin with a tour down the Grand Canal, "the finest street in the world." Next, the pedestrian streets around the Rialto Bridge are lined with shops, and St. Mark's Basilica is one of the oldest and most beautiful Byzantine cathedrals in all of Europe.

programme.title: Oahu, Hawaii
programme.desc: Have a blast with Laura on this Hawaiian voyage as you explore sensational surf and beaches, unique Hawaiian culture and food, and climb volcanic mountains. Join Laura as she visits historic landmarks, such as the Iolani Palace and the Bishop Museum.

programme.title: Perth Western Australia
programme.desc: In Western Australia, Jason visits vineyards, goes on a food adventure for crayfishes, truffles, and finger limes, and visits a Brazilian food in Perth city.

programme.title: Eating on the Mekong
programme.desc: Mekong River, Vietnam: On the river, Tony drinks a lot of Mekong moonshine with the welcoming owners of a duck farm. Although seduced by his Vietnam experience, Tony is not sure the royal dish Birds Nest Soup is all its cracked up to be.

programme.title: S9E1 - Oaxaca's Most Magical Holiday
programme.desc: Rick takes us on a remarkable journey through Oaxaca City during the revered Dia de Los Muertos (Day of the Dead) holiday. Much preparation for the celebration takes place in October, and Rick gives us an insider’s look at the fiesta.

programme.title: S9E2 - Oaxaca's Live-Fire Cooking
programme.desc: Everything tastes better when cooked over a fire, at least that is the Oaxacan credo. From soup to barbacoa, fiery embers influence the flavor of Oaxaca’s food in just the right ways. Join Rick in Oaxaca, San Felipe Usila, and Zaachilla.

programme.title: S9E3 - Off the Beaten Path in Huatulco
programme.desc: Mexico's beaches glimmer with pristine perfection. Chef Rick Bayless takes us off the beaten path to find great food and even better beaches such as Playa Chahue and Playa Principal. You would be well-advised to follow his lead.

programme.title: S9E4 - Artisan Mescal
programme.desc: Mescal is experiencing a renaissance in Mexico and throughout the United States. Journey with Rick to witness firsthand how an Oaxacan distiller handcrafts this fine spirit renowned for its rich, smoky complexity and brightness.

programme.title: United States of Sports
programme.desc: Copa90’s Eli and Timbsy and Love Island’s Josh Denzel go on a once-in-a-lifetime road trip. Then, the guys hit the Midwest for an unforgettable road trip through Detroit, Chicago and Cincinnati.

programme.title: America's Musical Journey
programme.desc: A cross-country adventure through the musical heritage of America and the cultural cities where America's music was born.

programme.title: USA Through Film, Food & Music
programme.desc: A journey through the USA, through the diverse food and music scenes of many vibrant cities.

programme.title: Bush Brawl
programme.desc: A dangerous frozen river landing leaves Jim and Ferno skating on thin ice, while Ariel's flying lessons end in disaster and the biggest snowstorm of the season hits.

programme.title: Creole Cold Cuts
programme.desc: Guy visits a multi-generational joint bringing NOLA to LA, a unique Minneapolis deli serving up meatless `meats' and a Hawaiian noodle spot dishing out ramen and Vietnamese crepes.

programme.title: For the Love of Music: The Story of Nashville
programme.desc: For over 130 years, Nashville has been at the forefront of the music scene. From the 1800s when the Fisk Jubilee Singers traveled the continent, to Johnny Cash, to The Black Keys, this is a special place with a story to tell.

programme.title: Trails & Trailblazers
programme.desc: Join pilot Ariel Tweto as she flies to unexpected places along the trails and wild spaces of America, meeting trailblazers in science, history, and exploration along the way.

programme.title: Puerto Rico Street Food Face Off
programme.desc: Sorted heads to Puerto Rico to find the best food this beautiful island has to offer.

programme.title: Beat the Chef Cook Off
programme.desc: The guys go head to head in a battle to end all battles - can Barry and Jamie beat Ben in making a traditional mofongo??

programme.title: 2 Chefs. 6 Food Challenges.
programme.desc: What better setting for a chef vs chef food challenge than Portland, Oregon?

programme.title: Ultimate Chef vs Chef Grill Battle
programme.desc: James and Ben continue their Oregon food challenge adventure down the stunning Oregon coast.

programme.title: Ultimate New Orleans Food Challenge
programme.desc: The guys find a different side of New Orleans.

programme.title: The Ultimate Po'boy Sandwich Battle
programme.desc: The guys go head to head to create the best po’ boy they can. Who will come out on top?!

programme.title: Lucky in Love
programme.desc: Real couples go on a game of chance throughout the United States making decisions through the flip of a coin.

programme.title: New Mexico True Stories: The Mother Road
programme.desc: A lot of people start out with a casual look at Route 66 and end up making it a life passion.

programme.desc: Andrew eats his way through the Southern BBQ Trail.

programme.title: Bizarre Foods with Andrew Zimmern
programme.desc: From pork shoulder cooked underground to whitefish plucked from Lake Superior, Andrew explores the Upper Peninsula.

programme.desc: Anthony and Shikira check out California’s North Coast where they visit a tattoo museum and learn a local language.

programme.title: Meet the Twetos
programme.desc: In the frigid Alaskan town of Unalakleet, the Twetos battle the arctic elements to transport supplies to some of the most inaccessible areas on the planet.

programme.title: Life or Death
programme.desc: Pilot Luke Hickerson transports dangerous chemicals from Barrow to the remote village of Atqasuk. Then the cold and dark winter claims its first casualty and Jim must make arrangements to transport the casket.

programme.title: America's Treasures: National Parks
programme.desc: A cinematic journey through the awe-inspiring landscapes, historic sites and untamed wilderness of America's most legendary outdoor playgrounds.

programme.title: United States of Sports
programme.desc: Copa90’s Eli and Timbsy and Love Island’s Josh Denzel go on a once-in-a-lifetime road trip. Then, the guys hit the Midwest for an unforgettable road trip through Detroit, Chicago and Cincinnati.

programme.title: Beef Lamb Pig
programme.desc: Guy hunts down all kinds of meaty favorites from cottage pie to Asian-barbeque in Kentucky and North Carolina.

programme.title: Tokyo and Beyond
programme.desc: In the first episode of the whistle-stop aerial journey across Japan, we visit Tokyo, the largest city in the world. Next we see the cities of Shimoda, Nagasaki, and the old castle town of Kanazawa. After that, we learn more about Japan’s unique geography

programme.title: Sevengill Shark
